section.para: This command reloads the routing data from the data source.

Important: When new domains have been added, a restart of the server must be done, because the mapping of the ids used in the config script cannot be updated at runtime at the moment. So a reload could result in a wrong routing behaviour, because the ids used in the script could differ from the one used internally from the server. Modifying of already existing domains is no problem.
This command prints the route rules on the command line.
This command adds a new host to the route rules

para.emphasis: One long string parameter that contains the arguments for this command
kamctl rpc cr.add_host -- '-h test.domain.com:5060 -d proxy -p null -w 0.1'

section.para: This command deletes a host from the route rules

para.emphasis: One long string parameter that contains the arguments for this command
kamctl rpc cr.delete_host -- '-h test.domain.com:5060 -d proxy -p null'

section.para: This command activates a host from the route rules

para.emphasis: One long string parameter that contains the arguments for this command
kamctl rpc cr.activate_host -- '-h test.domain.com:5060 -d proxy -p null'

section.para: This command deactivates a host from the route rules

para.emphasis: One long string parameter that contains the arguments for this command
kamctl rpc cr.deactivate_host -- '-h test.domain.com:5060 -d proxy -p null'

section.para: This command replaces a host from the route rules

para.emphasis: One long string parameter that contains the arguments for this command
kamctl rpc cr.replace_host -- '-h test1.domain.com:5060 -d proxy -t test2.domain.com:5060'
